alert.note: Alert for Mineral; Pershing (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 3:06PM PDT until August 09 at 6:15PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: .A broad cluster of strong thunderstorms continues to move north through eastern Churchill and Pershing counties. Areas that repeatedly see storms move overhead this afternoon will likely experience some minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Nevada and western Nevada, including the following counties, in west central Nevada, Churchill and Pershing. In western Nevada, Mineral. This includes US-50 east of Frenchman. * WHEN...Until 600 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in US-50 east of Frenchman. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Horse Creek, Little Den Creek, Spring Creek, Dixie Valley Wash, Cedar Creek, Bernice Creek, Camp Creek, Freeman Creek, Big Den Creek, Rock Creek, Edwards Creek, Cow Creek, Home Station Wash, Topia Creek, Eastgate Wash, Shoshone Creek, Gabbs Wash, Jersey Valley Wash, Elevenmile Wash, Bench Creek and Cherry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Middlegate, Healy Peak, Mount Augusta, Dixie Valley, Silver Hill, Mount Lincoln, Junction U.S 50 And NV 722, Hyder Hot Springs, Junction U.S 50 And Nv 121 (Dixie Valley Rd), Lone Rock, Fairview Peak, Frenchman and Cain Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
